attributes.action: Halt the crisis in UK education by increasing school budgets in real terms
attributes.additional_details:
Schools have already been forced to make cuts and, without change will make further cuts including:
 Increase class sizes/reduce the number of teachers
 Staff teaching outside of their specialism
 Cut the number of courses
 Reduce curriculum time for courses
 Cut extra-curricular
 Reduce admin, teacher training & pastoral care
 Reduce the support staff to work with children with SEN
 Remove counselling support
Reductions in Health and Social Care, we are being asked to do more with less
attributes.background: You may have read that funding in education is at record levels, because there are more children in the education system than before. Schools have had real-terms budget reductions because of the ‘flat cash settlement’ creating a 10% cut in real terms. While Pensions, NI and staff costs have gone up.
